content.description: First rule of Spite Club is we don't talk about Spite Club. This boulder is awesome! This one can be a bit of a scary fall if you biff it near the top. Bring spotters and bring pads! Start off immediately with hand-fist stacks and scooch on through. There is only one correct way to face, can you figure it out?
content.location: If you started on Plan B, start heading back towards town. If you are coming from town, you follow Kane Creek until it opens up into Kane Springs, past Ice Cream Parlor and all of that. You'll pass one large campground. You will then come up on a second campground, park at the dumpsters. Cross the road, and follow the wash. You will see a huge, flat sided boulder, that's it! Hike towards it and try to avoid traveling on the delicate soil crust please!

content.description: This boulder is the hardest of the bunch so far. Find two boulders leaning against each other, creating a mini cave. Start all the way in the back and wrestle your way up and on top. Sounds simple, it's not. Have fun figuring it out.
content.location: If you are starting the circuit proper, head back towards town. You'll pass a larger kiosk parking lot on the right, continue until you come up to a cattle guard and park on the right just before it. Cross the cattle guard, and hike towards the obvious cliff band on the North side of the road. Make sure you cross the cattle guard before you head towards the boulder so you don't have to jump over barbed wire. Cross the sometimes big or sometimes tiny stream and head towards the mouth of the wash and follow that for about 5 minutes. The wash will open up once you see a large hueco-ed boulder that you can crawl under. Start meandering left and up the hill until you come across the two large boulders.

content.description:
(don't tell the admins, it's not an offwidth!)

Splitter tight hands start leads to off fingers, fingers, and then a few tight hands pods in a right-leaning crack. Fun finger and tight hands training!

Downclimb the route to get down.
content.location:
Do the Rat Trap Approach, but turn off left at the giant patinaed boulder. Slim Jim is on the back of the boulder.

Please tread carefully as the cryptobiotic soils are delicate!

content.description:
Like a rat in a trap! This boulder starts as a hand crack and quickly goes to fists, then stacks.

It's a great boulder to teach people how to do offwidth technique. I did a few calf lock moves to get through the crux.

Downclimb Mighty Mouse to reach the ground again.

(Please leave the rat skeleton where it is, it's really cool and I want other people to see it)
content.protection: Crash pad, spotters, downclimb mighty mouse
content.location: Do the Plan B approach but at the final right turn (cairn marked), go left up the wash towards the Rat Trap boulder.

content.description: Large boulder starting with perfect 4's. The higher you climb, it gradually widens up.
content.location: Once you have found the pullout on the left, find a main wash. Follow this wash as it starts to head east. PLEASE STAY IN THE WASH! This wash takes you straight to the boulder. As you get closer to the boulder, the wash starts to dip down and you lose sight of the boulder. There will be an easy exit out of the wash that brings you to the base of the problem.

content.description: A perfect invert offwidth boulder for those trying to get into the style. Just a few moves of inverting followed by a quick and dirty pivot. Grab the jug, stand on the ledge and feel mighty!

Invert offwidth at its finest. Stack your way to glory and sand.

Downclimb the route to get back to earth.
Wide, wiggle, and wobble your way woefully wupward.
content.location: Park at Ice Cream Parlor, cross the road, following several cairns across the wash, then continue up the gully until you see the crack.

content.description: This route is on the same boulder as Spite Club, but on the opposite side! It looks ugly, but it's super fun! Start with a weird invert and flip into a hand slot, traverse out, invert again off the hand jam, and then flip into scary, but solid chimney moves to the top. If you fall after you've inverted for a second time, you might be looking at a broken ankle. Bring spotters and pads!
content.location: Follow the directions for Spite Club!

content.description: This boulder surprisingly wasn't established until 2017! This thing is big and beautiful and right next to the road. A bit of a sandbag for the grade, start of with fist-hand stacks and bump until you can flip up. Really try hard to not fall here. The ground is at a bit of a down hill and there are some pretty uncomfortable boulders under the pads. Bring a lot of spotters and pads if you are new to the offwidthing thing.
content.location: Once again, if you started the circuit proper, head back towards town. You'll go all the way to the big parking lot at Tombstone and you'll park at the pullout directly beneath Tombstone. No topo needed here, if you aren't blind you should see it immediately, sitting tall and proud by the road.

content.description:
This one is behind Anal Flare. Not like your every other invert, this one is a bit tricky. Once you figure it out, it's quite easy. Watch your back and head on this one spotters!

Maybe 100' up the hill from the Anal Flair, where two boulders lean against each other. A great first invert. Possible to climb without inverting, but definitely harder. Also, the grade is easier if you can get a fist to start. If you can't, then maybe V2.
content.location: If you started the circuit proper, head back towards town. You'll go up the steep switchback section of the dirt road and continue until you see a large pullout on the right, park there. If you are seeking just these beauties out, turn onto Kane Creek road and follow this road for 6.6 miles. You'll a large pullout on you left, the Cable Arch trailhead, park there! Starting at Anal Flare, go right, around the boulder and hike up a couple feet until you reach flatter ground, go left, down and back up towards the right. Just check the map! It's less confusing.

content.description: This boulder was on of the first to be established on the Invert Offwidth Boulder Circuit. They were discovered by Mary Eden and Matt Farrell for climb purposes, but I'm sure were gazed upon by the many people hiking along the Cable Arch Trail. This is a great boulder for learning how to invert....depending on your size. If you are small, it'll be V0 but if you are larger, it's closer to V3 grade. Crux is squeezing your thigh through the pinch, don't worry, you'll see it.
content.location: If you started the circuit proper, head back towards town. You'll go up the steep switchback section of the dirt road and continue until you see a large pullout on the right, park there. If you are seeking just these beauties out, turn onto Kane Creek road and follow this road for 6.6 miles. You'll a large pullout on you left, the Cable Arch trailhead, park there! You can pretty much see the first boulder Anal Flare, from the road.
